messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Eating Mannerisms
messages.msgSnippet: ... I do, too, as does my sister. My mother was quite proper in some ways and taught us a few good manners :-) My husband, raised by an English mother, also
messages.messageBody:
At 08:39 AM 3/12/03 -0800, Robin wrote:

> > I've never seen Canadians eat that way. Maybe in the east?
> > Tia
>
>*I* eat that way! But I think we've only had muffins and coffee together
>where you might have noticed.

I do, too, as does my sister. My mother was quite proper in some ways and
taught us a few good manners :-) My husband, raised by an English mother,
also eats this way, but I don't think it is the norm in Nova Scotia. Most
people (men especially) use their forks like shovels.

Donna Andrea in Nova Scotia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Eating Mannerisms
messages.msgSnippet: ... *I* eat that way!  But I think we ve only had muffins and coffee together where you might have noticed. I learned the European way from my British parents,
messages.messageBody:
> I've never seen Canadians eat that way. Maybe in the east?
> Tia

*I* eat that way! But I think we've only had muffins and coffee together
where you might have noticed.

I learned the European way from my British parents, reinforced by naval mess
dinners.

Robin B.
